column2: Whole grain bread, Avocado, Salt, Pepper, Red pepper flakes, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil
column4: 2. Mash avocado and spread it evenly on the toast.
column5: 3. Sprinkle with salt pepper and red pepper flakes to taste.
column6: 4. Optionally top with sliced cherry tomatoes and a drizzle of olive oil.

column2: Greek yogurt, Granola, Mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Honey
column3: 1. In a bowl or glass layer Greek yogurt granola and mixed berries.
column4: 2. Repeat layers until the container is filled.
column5: 3. Drizzle honey on top if desired.

column2: Oats, Bananas, Apples, Cinnamon, Maple syrup
column3: 1. Cook oats according to package instructions.
column4: 2. Once cooked top with sliced bananas diced apples and a sprinkle of cinnamon.
column5: 3. Optionally add a drizzle of maple syrup for sweetness.

column2: Frozen mixed berries, Banana, Spinach, Greek yogurt, Almond milk, Granola, Honey
column3: 1. In a blender combine frozen mixed berries banana spinach Greek yogurt and almond milk.
column5: 3. Pour into a bowl and top with sliced banana granola and a drizzle of honey.

column2: Eggs, Bell peppers, Onion, Spinach, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Cheese (optional)
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced bell peppers onions and spinach to the skillet.
column6: 4. Crack eggs into the skillet and scramble until cooked through.
column7: 5. Season with salt pepper and a sprinkle of cheese if desired.

column2: Quinoa, Mixed vegetables (such as cucumber, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, red onion), Chickpeas, Lemon juice, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as parsley, cilantro)
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
column4: 2. In a large bowl combine cooked quinoa mixed vegetables and chickpeas.
column5: 3. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil and season with salt pepper and fresh herbs.
column6: 4. Toss to combine and serve chilled.

column2: Tomatoes, Fresh mozzarella cheese, Fresh basil, Balsamic vinegar, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Slice tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese into rounds.
column4: 2. Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate alternating with fresh basil leaves.
column5: 3. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and olive oil.
column6: 4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

column2: Whole grain bread, Avocado, Salt, Pepper, Red pepper flakes, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil
column4: 2. Mash avocado and spread it evenly on the toast.
column5: 3. Sprinkle with salt pepper and red pepper flakes to taste.
column6: 4. Optionally top with sliced cherry tomatoes and a drizzle of olive oil.

column2: Whole wheat tortilla, Hummus, Mixed vegetables (such as lettuce, cucumber, bell peppers, carrots, avocado), Feta cheese (optional), Lemon juice, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Spread a layer of hummus on a whole wheat tortilla.
column4: 2. Add mixed vegetables and crumbled feta cheese (if using) on top.
column5: 3. Drizzle with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
column7: 5. Slice the wrap in half and serve.

column2: Romaine lettuce, Cucumber, Cherry tomatoes, Red onion, Kalamata olives, Feta cheese, Olive oil, Lemon juice, Dried oregano, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Chop romaine lettuce and cucumber halve cherry tomatoes and thinly slice red onion.
column4: 2. Combine chopped vegetables in a large bowl with kalamata olives and crumbled feta cheese.
column5: 3. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
column6: 4. Sprinkle with dried oregano salt and pepper.
column7: 5. Toss to coat evenly and serve chilled.

column2: Mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snap peas), Tofu, Soy sauce, Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Sesame seeds, Green onions
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
column4: 2. Add minced garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant.
column5: 3. Add sliced tofu and cook until lightly browned.
column6: 4. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
column7: 5. Stir in soy sauce and cook for another minute.
column8: 6. Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions before serving.

column2: Eggplant, Marinara sauce (store-bought or homemade), Mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, Breadcrumbs, Italian seasoning, Salt, Pepper, Olive oil
column4: 2. Slice eggplant into rounds and season with salt and pepper.
column5: 3. Dip eggplant slices in beaten egg then coat with breadcrumbs mixed with Italian seasoning.
column6: 4. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook breaded eggplant slices until golden brown on both sides.
column7: 5. Spread marinara sauce in the bottom of a baking dish then arrange a layer of cooked eggplant slices on top.
column8: 6. Sprinkle with shredded mozzarella and grated Parmesan cheese.
column9: 7. Repeat layers until all eggplant slices are used finishing with a layer of cheese on top.
column10: 8. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

column2: Arborio rice, Vegetable broth, Mushrooms (such as cremini or shiitake), Onion, Garlic, White wine (optional), Parmesan cheese (optional), Butter (optional), Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh parsley
column3: 1. In a saucepan heat vegetable broth and keep it warm over low heat.
column4: 2. In a separate large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat.
column5: 3. Add diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet
column7: 4. Add sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until browned and tender.
column8: 5. Stir in Arborio rice and cook for 1-2 minutes until lightly toasted.
column9: 6. If using add white wine to the skillet and stir until absorbed.
column10: 7. Begin adding warm vegetable broth to the skillet 1 cup at a time stirring frequently and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding more.
column11: 8. Continue adding broth and stirring until the rice is creamy and tender about 20-25 minutes.
column12: 9. If desired stir in grated Parmesan cheese and butter for added creaminess.
column13: 10. Season with salt and pepper to taste and garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.

column2: Mixed vegetables (such as cauliflower, carrots, bell peppers, peas), Coconut milk, Curry powder, Garlic, Ginger, Onion, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh cilantro, Cooked rice (for serving)
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat.
column5: minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet and cook until softened and fragrant.
column6: 3. Stir in curry powder and cook for another minute.
column7: 4. Add mixed vegetables to the skillet and stir to coat with the curry mixture.
column8: 5. Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
column9: 6. Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
column10: 7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
column11: 8. Serve vegetable curry over cooked rice and garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.

column2: Jumbo pasta shells, Ricotta cheese, Spinach, Marinara sauce (store-bought or homemade), Mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, Garlic, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Italian seasoning
column4: 2. Cook jumbo pasta shells according to package instructions then drain and set aside.
column5: 3. In a skillet heat olive oil over medium heat and sauté minced garlic until fragrant.
column6: 4. Add chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted.
column7: 5. In a mixing bowl combine ricotta cheese cooked spinach grated Parmesan cheese salt pepper and Italian seasoning.
column8: 6. Stuff each cooked pasta shell with the ricotta mixture.
column9: 7. Spread marinara sauce in the bottom of a baking dish then arrange stuffed shells on top.
column11: 9. Cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes.
column12: 10. Remove foil and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
